thread.title: Bee Gees' Barry Gibb receives a Grammy tribute | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Bee Gees' Barry Gibb receives a Grammy tribute | Daily Mail Online

author: Cassie Carpenter For Dailymail.Com
title: Bee Gees' Barry Gibb receives a Grammy tribute | Daily Mail Online
text: Share this article Share The British 70-year-old seemed less enthused about the 24-year-old American Idol alum and shot her a puzzled look. Little Big Town put a fun country spin on How Deep Is Your Love? that got both Rihanna and Carrie Underwood dancing in the audience. Grammy nominee: The 24-year-old pop diva - who lost the pop vocal album trophy to Adele - kicked off the show with her powerful rendition of Stayin' Alive Sing it! The former Disney Channel starlet sported waist-length hair extensions as well as a plunging sequinned jumpsuit selected by stylist Avo Yermagyan Blonde ambition: Also celebrating the 40th anniversary of Saturday Night Fever and the 50th anniversary of the Brothers Gibb was a guitar-strumming Tori Kelly, who performed Tragedy Ummm...: The British 70-year-old seemed less enthused about the 24-year-old American Idol alum and shot her a puzzled look Barry seemed excited too and sang along with the Alabama foursome's Karen Fairchild, Kimberly Schlapman, Jimi Westbrook, and Phillip Sweet. 32-year-old Andra (born Cassandra Batie) then donned a fabulous quilted kimono jacket to croon an energetic version of Night Fever. Curiously, Saturday Night Fever's star John Travolta did not join the Bee Gees tribute despite earlier introducing Keith Urban and Carrie Underwood. Four-part harmony: Little Big Town put a fun country spin on How Deep Is Your Love? that got both Rihanna and Carrie Underwood dancing in the audience Into it: Barry seemed excited too and sang along with the Alabama foursome's Karen Fairchild, Kimberly Schlapman, Jimi Westbrook, and Phillip Sweet Crooner: 32-year-old Andra (born Cassandra Batie) then donned a fabulous quilted kimono jacket to croon an energetic version of Night Fever Over it? Curiously, Saturday Night Fever's star John Travolta did not join the Bee Gees tribute despite earlier introducing Keith Urban and Carrie Underwood The 15-time Grammy winners - formed in 1958 - sold more than 220M records worldwide before the deaths of twins Maurice and Robin in 2003 and 2012, respectively. Virtually the same group of big belters - including Gibb, Celine Dion, and John Legend - will reunite for Stayin' Alive: A Grammy Salute to air later this year on CBS. And on Friday, Bee Gees released a remix of Stayin' Alive (Serban Mix) from eight-time Grammy winner Serban Ghenea. RIP: The 15-time Grammy winners - formed in 1958 - sold more than 220M records worldwide before the deaths of twins Maurice (L) and Robin (R) in 2003 and 2012, respectively Airing later this year on CBS! Virtually the same group of big belters - including Gibb, Celine Dion, and John Legend - will reunite for Stayin' Alive: A Grammy Salute Reimagining: And on Friday, Bee Gees released a remix of Stayin' Alive (Serban Mix) from eight-time Grammy winner Serban Ghenea GRAMMY AWARDS 2017 WINNERS
